subtasks.name: Frontend Development
subtasks.notes: Implement UI components for the content editor, scheduler, and analytics dashboard. Ensure responsive design.

subtasks.name: Implement the Header
subtasks.notes:
Build the Header
    Features:
        A minimalist header with the application name centered.
        Action icons on the right: notifications, settings, and profile.
    Implementation:
        Use HTML and CSS to create the header section.
        Ensure the header is fixed at the top and spans the full width of the application window.
        Add the icons and set up placeholders for their functionalities.

subtasks.name: Create the Collapsible Menu (Left Sidebar)
subtasks.notes:
Features:
        Navigation options with both icons and text labels: Dashboard, Content Creation, Scheduler, Analytics, Settings.
        Ability to collapse the menu to show only icons or hide it completely.
    Implementation:
        Structure the menu using HTML <nav> elements and list items.
        Style the menu with CSS to handle both expanded and collapsed states.
        Implement the collapse functionality using JavaScript in renderer.js.
        Add event listeners to handle user interactions for expanding and collapsing the menu.

subtasks.name: HTML Structure for Navigation Menu
subtasks.notes: Create the HTML structure for the navigation sidebar using <nav> and <ul> elements. Include placeholders for each navigation option (Dashboard, Content Creation, Scheduler, Analytics, Settings).

subtasks.name: CSS Styling for Expanded and Collapsed States
subtasks.notes: Write CSS to style the sidebar in both its expanded state (with icons and text) and its collapsed state (with icons only).

subtasks.name: JavaScript for Menu Collapse Functionality
subtasks.notes: Implement the JavaScript logic in renderer.js to add collapse/expand functionality, including event listeners for user interactions.

subtasks.name: Develop the Content Editor (Center Area)
subtasks.notes:
Features:
A distraction-free writing environment.
Rich text formatting options similar to LinkedIn's capabilities.
Real-time spell-checking and grammar suggestions.
AI-enhanced writing assistance with subtle inline prompts.

Implementation:

Integrate a Rich Text Editor Library:
Install Quill or TinyMCE:

bash

Copy code
npm install quill 
Include the library in your index.html and initialize it in renderer.js.
Configure the toolbar to match LinkedIn's formatting options.

Implement Spell-Checking and Grammar Suggestions:
Use a library like https://www.npmjs.com/package/spellchecker or integrate with your AI module.
Highlight misspelled words and grammar issues in real-time.

Add AI-Enhanced Writing Assistance:
Capture the text input and send it to your AI module (ai/ai.js) for suggestions.
Display AI suggestions in a non-intrusive manner, such as underlined text or tooltips.
Allow users to accept or ignore suggestions easily.

subtasks.name: Implement Basic Text Editing Features
subtasks.notes:
Toolbar Configuration: Configure Quill.js to include a comprehensive toolbar, featuring options for bold, italic, underline, bullet lists, numbered lists, links, and image embedding.
    User Customization: Customize the toolbar to ensure it meets user requirements and provides an intuitive editing experience.

subtasks.name: Add Custom Plugins and Enhancements
subtasks.notes:
Media Embedding: Integrate a custom button for image uploads or other media embedding to extend the functionality of the editor.
    Additional Formatting Options: Develop any additional formatting capabilities based on stakeholder feedback, such as custom fonts, styles, or sizes.

subtasks.name: Connect the Editor to Backend APIs
subtasks.notes:
Draft Saving and Loading: Implement functionality to save drafts to both local storage and a backend server to ensure data persistence.
    Autosave Feature: Develop an autosave mechanism that periodically saves the user's work, providing a seamless editing experience.
    Draft Retrieval: Enable users to load previously saved drafts when they revisit the editor, ensuring they can continue where they left off.

subtasks.name: Design the Analytics Panel
subtasks.notes:
Features:
Displays key metrics: engagement metrics, follower growth, reach, and impressions.
Interactive graphs and charts.
Implementation:
Integrate a Charting Library:
Install Chart.js:

bash

Copy code
npm install chart.js 
Include it in your HTML and set up canvas elements for your charts.
Use sample data to create initial charts and ensure they render correctly.
Layout and Styling:
Use CSS to style the analytics panel to be visually appealing but not distracting.
Ensure the panel is responsive and complements the content editor.

subtasks.name: Backend Development
subtasks.notes: Develop RESTful APIs. Set up the database and implement data models.

subtasks.name: Leverage Direct Database Calls to access local database
Connect Application to LinkedIn API.  We will leverage my account at first
LinkedIn API Integration
subtasks.notes: Implement OAuth 2.0 authentication.  Also leverage an individuals user account. Enable automated posting and data retrieval.

subtasks.name: Integrate the OpenAI GPT-4 model into the program or product
Verify bidirectional communications and create a local cache of the data to prevent access network traffic.
Enable the ability to publish a post to LinkedIn, this will be privately posted at first to ensure our audience isn't getting spammed while we work out the details
The application will be able to pull, collect, analyze, and store metrics on the success of the posts it contributes to and on how the audience grows over time
AI Features Implementation
subtasks.notes: Integrate AI tools for content suggestions. Add grammar and style checking.

subtasks.name: Finish setting up AI module
subtasks.notes:
Configure OpenAI API for AI suggestions, ensure secure API storage

a. Set Up the AI Module (ai/ai.js)
Implementation:
Ensure your OpenAI API key is securely stored using environment variables.
In ai/ai.js, create functions to interact with the OpenAI API.

javascript

Copy code
const { Configuration, OpenAIApi } = require('openai');  const configuration = new Configuration({   apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY, }); const openai = new OpenAIApi(configuration);  async function getAISuggestions(prompt) {   try {     const response = await openai.createCompletion({       model: 'text-davinci-003',       prompt: prompt,       max_tokens: 150,       n: 1,       stop: null,       temperature: 0.7,     });     return response.data.choices[0].text.trim();   } catch (error) {     console.error('Error fetching AI suggestions:', error);     return '';   } }  module.exports = { getAISuggestions }; 
Notes:
Handle API errors gracefully to ensure the application remains stable.
Respect OpenAI's usage policies and rate limits.

subtasks.name: Integrate AI Assistance into the Content Editor
subtasks.notes:
b. Integrate AI Assistance into the Content Editor
Implementation:
In your renderer.js, capture user input from the editor.

javascript

Copy code
const quill = new Quill('#editor', { /* configuration */ });  quill.on('text-change', async () => {   const userInput = quill.getText();   const suggestion = await getAISuggestions(userInput);   // Display the suggestion in the editor }); 
Display AI suggestions as inline prompts or in a suggestion box.
Allow users to accept suggestions by clicking on them or via keyboard shortcuts.
Provide a feedback mechanism for users to rate suggestions.

subtasks.name: Collect data to improve the program and the success of the content
Testing During Development
subtasks.notes: Perform unit testing for each module. Begin integration testing.

subtasks.name: Comprehensive Testing
subtasks.notes: Conduct system testing and security testing.

subtasks.name: User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
subtasks.notes: Involve end-users to test the application. Collect feedback.

subtasks.name: Bug Fixing and Optimization
subtasks.notes: Address issues discovered during testing. Optimize performance.

subtasks.name: Set Up Testing Framework and Unit Tests
subtasks.notes:
a. Set Up a Testing Framework
Implementation:
Install Jest:

bash

Copy code
npm install --save-dev jest 
Configure Jest in your package.json:

json

Copy code
"scripts": {   "test": "jest" } 
Notes:
Organize tests in a __tests__ directory or alongside the modules they test.
Write unit tests for critical functions in your application.
b. Write Unit Tests
Example: Testing the AI Module

javascript

Copy code
// ai/ai.test.js const { getAISuggestions } = require('./ai');  test('getAISuggestions returns a string', async () => {   const suggestion = await getAISuggestions('Test prompt');   expect(typeof suggestion).toBe('string'); }); 
Notes:
Mock external API calls where possible to avoid unnecessary requests during testing.
Ensure tests are repeatable and do not depend on external state.
c. Perform Integration Testing
Implementation:
Test the interaction between the content editor and the AI module.
Simulate user actions and verify that the application responds correctly.
Notes:
Use testing tools like Spectron for Electron applications.
Continuously run tests during development to catch issues early.

subtasks.notes: Set up servers and databases on a hosting platform.

subtasks.name: Deploy Application
subtasks.notes: Launch the application in the production environment.

subtasks.name: Monitoring and Logging
subtasks.notes: Integrate monitoring tools. Set up logging for error tracking.

subtasks.name: Post-Deployment Support
subtasks.notes: Monitor the application for post-launch issues. Provide technical support to users.

subtasks.name: Feedback Collection
subtasks.notes: Implement feedback mechanisms within the app. Plan for future enhancements.

subtasks.name: Regular Updates
subtasks.notes: Schedule regular maintenance. Keep dependencies and libraries up to date.

subtasks.name: Backup and Recovery Plans
subtasks.notes: Establish data backup routines. Develop disaster recovery strategies.

subtasks.notes: Conduct meetings to understand specific needs and goals. Identify core features and functionalities.

subtasks.name: Research
subtasks.notes: Review LinkedIn API documentation. Explore AI tools for content generation and editing.

subtasks.name: Project Plan Development
subtasks.notes: Create a detailed project roadmap. Establish timelines and milestones.

subtasks.name: Resource Allocation
subtasks.notes: Assemble the development team. Assign roles and responsibilities.

subtasks.name: System Architecture Design
subtasks.notes: Define the overall system architecture. Plan for scalability and security.

subtasks.name: Design Review Meeting
subtasks.notes: Review system architecture and UI/UX designs with client.

subtasks.name: UI/UX Design
subtasks.notes: Create wireframes and mockups using tools like Figma. Design intuitive user interfaces.

subtasks.name: AI Integration Planning
subtasks.notes: The task is focused on planning the integration of the OpenAI GPT-4 model into a program or product. The team has decided to collect data that can benefit the improvement of the program and the success of the content being collaborated on. While the task is currently partially deferred, the team is working towards the completion of the AI integration planning by the due date of December 15, 2024.

subtasks.name: Database Schema Design
subtasks.notes: Design the database schema for the web application to create a flexible and scalable data model that supports its features and growth. The schema design is complete, including key entities like users, posts, schedules, and analytics data. Although the implementation and deployment of the new database structure are still in progress, finishing this task will establish a strong and scalable foundation for the web application.

subtasks.name: Create a database schema.  It should be optimal, efficient and fast.  It should enable our application experience to be monitored and improved over time.  It should collect posts from LinkedIn that are collaborated upon with the software, and their corresponding success based upon views, likes, reposts, etc. It will also keep track of writing samples which the users specifies are positive outcomes.
subtasks.notes:
a. Enhance the Database Schema
Implementation:
Add tables for schedules, analytics data, and user preferences in database/database.js.

javascript

Copy code
db.serialize(() => {   db.run(`     CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS schedules (       id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,       post_id INTEGER,       scheduled_time DATETIME,       FOREIGN KEY(post_id) REFERENCES posts(id)     )   `);   // Create other tables similarly }); 
Notes:
Ensure foreign key relationships are properly defined.
Plan for future scalability by considering indexing and query optimization.

subtasks.name: Implement Database Operations.  The database should be well maintained, and regular maintenance performed to clean up unsured, raw, and duplicate data so that it does not grow excessive.
subtasks.notes:
Implementation:
Write functions to perform CRUD operations for new tables.

javascript

Copy code
function addSchedule(postId, scheduledTime) {   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {     db.run(       `INSERT INTO schedules (post_id, scheduled_time) VALUES (?, ?)`,       [postId, scheduledTime],       function (err) {         if (err) reject(err);         else resolve(this.lastID);       }     );   }); } 
Notes:
Use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection.
Handle database errors appropriately.

subtasks.name: API Integration Planning
subtasks.notes: Outline integration points with LinkedIn's API.
